title: The Bite Fight prabhu_
description:
The Bite Fight: Tyson, Holyfield and the Night That Changed Boxing Forever

by George Willis

The infamous boxing match between Mike Tyson and Evander Holyfield on June 28, 1997, was like none other in the sportÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s history, and this insightful account of the anticipation, the gruesome fight itself, and the ongoing aftermath of that one night reveals just how much of an impact it really made. The rivals met for a rematch that would never be finished, as Tyson earned a disqualification and infamy that followed in the third round by biting off a portion of HolyfieldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ear. Through nearly 100 interviews, including with the famed fighters themselves, and extensive research of past interviews, books, and transcripts, this exploration of the sensational events surrounding the fight provides a behind-the-scenes, past and present look at the bout.

about author :-

GEORGE WILLIS HAS been a general sports columnist at the New York
Post since February 1997, and has been the primary boxing writer
since 2002. He previously worked at the New York Times from 1994
to 1997, serving as the beat reporter for the New York Mets and the New
Jersey Nets. Prior to that, he worked for seven years at New York Newsday,
covering the New York Giants, including their 1990 Super Bowl season.
As a columnist, WillisÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ writing has won awards from the Pro Football
Writers Association, the Golf Writers Association of America, and the
Boxing Writers Association of America.
A native of Las Cruces, New Mexico, Mr. Willis attended New
Mexico State University and graduated in 1983 with a degree in
Journalism. In 2012, he was named as one of NMSUÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Distinguished
Alumni.
He lives in Whippany, New Jersey, with his wife, Teresa, and
daughter, Taylor.
